free: #e It was in the early morning. We were still eating breakfast.
#c 是早上沒錯，(因為)我們(那時候)還在吃早餐。
#n (mai)=pama=ita q<m>an sa-taRbabi 我們還沒吃早餐。 ‘We haven’t had breakfast yet.’
#n yau=pama=ita q<m>an sa-taRbabi 我們還在吃早餐。 ‘We’re still having breakfast.’
#n pun=ti=iku q<m>an sa-taRbabi 我已經吃過早餐。 ‘I finished having breakfast.’
#n pun=ti sa-taRbabi-an 早餐準備好了。 ‘Breakfast is ready.’
#n pun=ti=iku s<m>angi tu sa-taRbabi-an 我已經準備好早餐了。 ‘I finished making breakfast.’
#n sa-taRbabi-an-ku zau. 我早餐要吃這些。 ‘This is what I am going to eat for breakfast.’

#n si-qadan=pa=iku tu paRin ‘I will sit on a wooden chair.’ 我要坐在一張木椅。

#n ‘sa-A B-an’ is a complex form referring to ‘go to B in A’, so A and B must be adjacent to each other.

free: #e (I’m) not sure when this will happen, but the situation would definitely become like that: Something will be taken away.
#c 不知何時，一定會變那樣，帶走這個...
#n iza在此事指石頭山. ‘iza’ refers to Stone mountain.
#n nayau siyu: 也許/應該是那樣 probably should be that way
#n qumni wanay: 不知何時/以後 don’t know when/later
#n tizitazau 會變成這樣 to become like this
#n tizitayau 會變成那樣 to become like that
#n tizi tu tama-na ya sunis a yau 會變成他爸爸那樣 become like his father
#n tanian wanay 不知在哪裡 don’t know where
#n mawtu=ti siyu 他或許來了 He may have already come.
#n mawtu=ti saizi 他已經來了 He has come.
#n mawtu=ti saiza 他可能來了(沒有親眼看到) He has probably arrived.

free: #e Those (children who were) left behind in a natural disaster.
#c 天災留下來的(小孩)。
#n penasaqay 是指如大地震或海嘯之類的天災，或是會導致許多人死亡的傳染病。natural disaster such as an earthquake or a flood/tsunami or a disease that can cause many people to die.
#n pasaqay 是指死去丈夫或太太的人 widow/widower, 由老人家帶到親戚朋友家 to be brought to a relative’s or a friend’s house by an elder (以前死去的丈夫或太太常去的地方where the dead person used to go) 去玩
#n pa-saqay tu sunis 牽小孩的手, 讓他練習走路 to hold the hand of a child to help him practice walking
#n sasaqay 去玩 have fun
#n pulazan 開路, 引導, 先驅 blaze a trail; guide; forerunner
#n pulazan=ay 開路的人 a person leading the way
#n pulazan=pa=iku tu sikawman 我來做開場白 I will make an introduction.
#n pulazan=iku 我來開路 I will lead the way.

free: #e The Southern Min people probably thought that stones would definitely lose.
#c 閩南人也許想說石頭一定會輸的。

#n m-ala=ti=iku 我贏了 I won. (lit. 我拿到了 I got it)
#n naRin paska timaizipana, qawman qa-suqas=isu 不要跟他比，你一定會輸的。 Don’t compare with him. You will definitely lose.
#n m-suqas=iku timaisuan 我輸你了 I lost to you.

free: #e How come (it is people other than Kavalan who are learning our language) instead?
#c 為什麼反而變成(是別人在學我們的語言)?
#n m-susup aizipna masang, iwaliu tangi aizipna si-kelisiw=ay: 他以前很窮,現在反而變成有錢人. He used to be poor ; now he’s rich.
